alert.note: Alert for Brewster; Pecos; Terrell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 5:12AM CDT until August 16 at 9:45AM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland/Odessa has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Brewster County in southwestern Texas... South Central Pecos County in southwestern Texas... Southern Terrell County in southwestern Texas... * Until 945 AM CDT. * At 512 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 4 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sanderson, Dryden and Terrell County Airport. This includes the following streams and drainages... Garcia Creek, Candilla Creek, Prairie Creek, Cow Creek, Pyle Draw, Sanderson Canyon, Grande, Rio, Cook Creek, Fresno Creek, Magoy Creek, Persimmon Creek, Maxon Creek, Thurston Canyon, Indian Creek, Pony Creek, San Francisco Creek, Meyers Canyon, Buena Creek, Cedar Creek, Downie Draw, Dry Creek and Big Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
